paper_abstract: We prove that L-infinity-approximation of C-infinity-functions defined on [0, 1](d) is intractable and suffers from the curse of dimensionality. This is done by showing that the minimal number of linear functionals needed to obtain an algorithm with worst case error at most epsilon is an element of (0, 1) is exponential in d. This holds despite the fact that the rate of convergence is infinite. (C) 2009 Published by Elsevier Inc.
paper_title: Approximation of infinitely differentiable multivariate functions is intractable
